5.2.1.10.3 Direct Slots
5.2.1.10.4 Indirect Slots

5.2.1.10.4.1 Slot: argument
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: argument
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.10.4.1.1 Description

Additional arguments with command

5.2.1.10.4.2 Inherited Slot: timestamp
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: 0.0d0
  • Initargs: timestamp
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.10.4.2.1 Description

Utility time stamp field for user

5.2.1.10.4.3 Slot: to
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.10.4.3.1 Description

Module or Gate which finally receices message (after a delay if appropriate)

5.2.1.10.4.4 Slot: from
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.10.4.4.1 Description

Module or gate from which message was originally sent.

5.2.1.10.4.5 Inherited Slot: creation-time
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: (SIMULATION-TIME)
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.10.4.5.1 Description

The creation time of the message. With cloned messages (see duplicate later), the creation time of the original message is returned and not the time of the cloning operation. This is particularly useful when modeling communication protocols, because many protocols clone the transmitted packages to be able to do retransmissions and/or segmentation/reassembly.

5.2.1.10.4.6 Inherited Slot: root-event
  • Value type: event
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.10.4.6.1 Description

Top level root for cloned messages

5.2.1.10.4.7 Slot: schedule-id
  • Value type: integer
  • Initial value: -1
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.10.4.7.1 Description

Used to ensure events with same time and priority are scheduled in order of scheduling

5.2.1.10.4.8 Slot: priority
  • Value type: fixnum
  • Initial value: 0
  • Initargs: priority
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.10.4.8.1 Description

Determines delivery of messages with same arrival time

5.2.1.10.4.9 Inherited Slot: arrival-time
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: -1.0d0
  • Initargs: time
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.10.4.9.1 Description

simulation time at which event is to be handled

5.2.1.10.4.10 Inherited Slot: sent-time
  • Value type: double-float
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.10.4.10.1 Description

The simulation time the message was sent.

5.2.1.10.4.11 Slot: rank
  • Value type: fixnum
  • Initial value: -1
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.10.4.11.1 Description

the source address of the received packet

5.2.1.12.4.4 Slot: header-overhead
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: 0
  • Initargs: byte-length, header-overhead
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.12.4.4.1 Description

In bytes

5.2.1.12.4.5 Inherited Slot: bit-error-p
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.12.4.5.1 Description

The result of error modelling after the packet is sent through a channel that has a nonzero packet error rate (PER) or bit error rate (BER). It is up to the receiver to examine this flag after having received the packet, and to act upon it.

5.2.1.12.4.6 Slot: reception-start-p
  • Value type: boolean
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: deliver-on-reception-start
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.12.4.6.1 Description

Identify whether this packet represents the start or the end of the reception after the packet travelled through a channel with a data rate. This flag is controlled by the deliver-on-reception-start flag of the receiving gate.

5.2.1.12.4.7 Inherited Slot: control-info
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: control-info
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.12.4.7.1 Description

Additional data to be passed with packet between protocol layers.

5.2.1.12.4.8 Internal Slot: duration
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: 0.0d0
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.12.4.8.1 Description

Duration of last transmission

5.2.1.12.4.9 Slot: encapsulated-packet
  • Value type: packet
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: encapsulated-packet
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.12.4.9.1 Description

Higher level encapsulated protocol packet.

5.2.1.12.4.10 Inherited Slot: timestamp
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: 0.0d0
  • Initargs: timestamp
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.12.4.10.1 Description

Utility time stamp field for user

5.2.1.12.4.11 Slot: to
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.12.4.11.1 Description

Module or Gate which finally receices message (after a delay if appropriate)

5.2.1.12.4.12 Slot: from
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.12.4.12.1 Description

Module or gate from which message was originally sent.

5.2.1.12.4.13 Inherited Slot: creation-time
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: (SIMULATION-TIME)
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.12.4.13.1 Description

The creation time of the message. With cloned messages (see duplicate later), the creation time of the original message is returned and not the time of the cloning operation. This is particularly useful when modeling communication protocols, because many protocols clone the transmitted packages to be able to do retransmissions and/or segmentation/reassembly.

5.2.1.12.4.14 Inherited Slot: root-event
  • Value type: event
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.12.4.14.1 Description

Top level root for cloned messages

5.2.1.12.4.15 Slot: schedule-id
  • Value type: integer
  • Initial value: -1
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.12.4.15.1 Description

Used to ensure events with same time and priority are scheduled in order of scheduling

5.2.1.12.4.16 Slot: priority
  • Value type: fixnum
  • Initial value: 0
  • Initargs: priority
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.12.4.16.1 Description

Determines delivery of messages with same arrival time

5.2.1.12.4.17 Inherited Slot: arrival-time
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: -1.0d0
  • Initargs: time
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.12.4.17.1 Description

simulation time at which event is to be handled

5.2.1.12.4.18 Inherited Slot: sent-time
  • Value type: double-float
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.12.4.18.1 Description

The simulation time the message was sent.

5.2.1.12.4.19 Slot: rank
  • Value type: fixnum
  • Initial value: -1
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.12.4.19.1 Description

Rank in priority queue - used internally for efficient removal from queue.

5.2.1.12.4.20 Inherited Slot: owner
  • Value type: named-object
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: owner
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.12.4.20.1 Description

Object which owns this in object heirarchy

  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: index
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.12.4.21.1 Description

5.2.1.12.4.22 Inherited Slot: name
  • Value type: symbol
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: name
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.12.4.22.1 Description

5.2.1.14 Class: mac802.15.4
5.2.1.14.1 Inheritance
  • Parent classes: mac
  • Precedence list: mac802.15.4, mac, comms-module, wsn-module, with-timers, module, component, parameter-object, entity-with-signals, owned object, named-object, lens object, standard-object, slot object, t
  • Direct subclasses: None.
5.2.1.14.2 Parameters
print-state-transitions
a boolean. Debugging parameter
max-mac-frame-size
a t. Default: 0. NIL
header-overhead
a t. Default: 14. NIL
buffer-size
a t. Default: 32. NIL
enable-slotted-csma
a boolean. Default: T. NIL
enable-cap
a boolean. Default: T. NIL
is-ffd
a boolean. NIL
is-pan-coordinator
a boolean. NIL
battery-life-extension
a boolean. NIL
frame-order
a fixnum. Default: 4. NIL
beacon-order
a fixnum. Default: 6. NIL
unit-backoff-period
a fixnum. Default: 20. NIL
base-slot-duration
a fixnum. Default: 60. NIL
num-superframe-slots
a fixnum. Default: 16. NIL
min-be
a fixnum. Default: 5. NIL
max-be
a fixnum. Default: 7. NIL
max-csma-backoffs
a fixnum. Default: 4. NIL
max-frame-retries
a fixnum. Default: 2. NIL
max-lost-beacons
a fixnum. Default: 4. NIL
min-cap-length
a fixnum. Default: 440. NIL
request-gts
a fixnum. Default: 0. NIL
guard-time
a time-type. Default: 0.001. NIL
5.2.1.14.3 Description

IEEE802.15.4 MAC implementation

5.2.1.14.5.18.1 Description

Position in an object vector (if it is in an object array)

5.2.1.14.5.19 Inherited Slot: name
  • Value type: symbol
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: name
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.14.5.19.1 Description

Name of this object - used when addressing the object internally or through simulation paramaters.

5.2.1.15 Class: mobility
5.2.1.15.1 Inheritance
  • Parent classes: wsn-module
  • Precedence list: mobility, wsn-module, with-timers, module, component, parameter-object, entity-with-signals, owned object, named-object, lens object, standard-object, slot object, t
  • Direct subclasses: no-mobility, line-mobility
5.2.1.15.2 Parameters
location
a coord. current location initalized from parameter file
orientation
a lens.wsn::orientation. Default: (MAKE-ORIENTATION). current orientation initialized from parameter gile
5.2.1.15.3 Description

Not documented.

  • Parent classes: routing
  • Precedence list: multipath-rings-routing, routing, comms-module, wsn-module, with-timers, module, component, parameter-object, entity-with-signals, owned-object, named-object, lens-object, standard-object, slot-object, t

a integer. Default: 13. NIL

5.2.1.17 Class: net-mac-control-info
5.2.1.17.1 Inheritance
  • Parent classes: standard-object
  • Precedence list: net-mac-control-info, standard-object, slot-object, t
  • Direct subclasses: None.
5.2.1.17.2 Description

We need to pass information between routing and MAC which is external to the packet i.e. not carried by a real packet (e.g., what is the next hop, or what was the RSSI for the packet received) but this information is related to the specific packet.

5.2.1.17.3 Direct Slots

5.2.1.17.3.1 Slot: rssi
  • Value type: double-float
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: rssi
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.17.3.1.1 Description

the RSSI of the received packet

5.2.1.17.3.1.2 Accessors

5.2.1.17.3.1.2.1 Slot Accessor: rssi
5.2.1.17.3.1.2.1.1 Syntax 
(rssi object)
5.2.1.17.3.1.2.1.2 Methods
  • (rssi (mac-radio-control-info lens.wsn:mac-radio-control-info))
  • (rssi (net-mac-control-info lens.wsn:net-mac-control-info))
  • (rssi (app-net-control-info lens.wsn:app-net-control-info))

5.2.1.17.3.2 Slot: lqi
  • Value type: double-float
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: lqi
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.17.3.2.1 Description

the LQI of the received packet

5.2.1.17.3.2.2 Accessors

5.2.1.17.3.2.2.1 Slot Accessor: lqi
5.2.1.17.3.2.2.1.1 Syntax 
(lqi object)
5.2.1.17.3.2.2.1.2 Methods
  • (lqi (mac-radio-control-info lens.wsn:mac-radio-control-info))
  • (lqi (net-mac-control-info lens.wsn:net-mac-control-info))
  • (lqi (app-net-control-info lens.wsn:app-net-control-info))

5.2.1.17.3.3 Slot: next-hop
  • Value type: integer
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: next-hop
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.17.3.3.1 Accessors

5.2.1.17.3.3.1.1 Slot Accessor: next-hop
5.2.1.17.3.3.1.1.1 Syntax

5.2.1.17.3.3.1.1.2 Methods
  • (next-hop (net-mac-control-info lens.wsn:net-mac-control-info))

  • Value type: integer
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: last-hop
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.17.3.4.1 Accessors

5.2.1.18 Inherited Class: network
5.2.1.18.1 Inheritance
  • Parent classes: compound-module
  • Precedence list: network, compound-module, module, component, parameter-object, entity-with-signals, owned-object, named-object, lens-object, standard-object, slot-object, t
  • Direct subclasses: tictoc12, tictoc10, tictoc8, tictoc4, tictoc2, tictoc1, wsn
5.2.1.18.2 Parameters
5.2.1.18.3 Description

Base class for networks. This is the required type for the top-level compound-module of a simulation network and it is required that it has no gate specification. It is specified in the network simulation parameter.

5.2.1.18.4 Direct Slots

5.2.1.18.4.1 Slot: gate-slots
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance

  • Initargs: none

  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance

5.2.1.19.5.10.1 Description

5.2.1.19.5.11 Inherited Slot: index
  • Value type: fixnum
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: index
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.19.5.11.1 Description

Position in an object vector (if it is in an object array)

5.2.1.19.5.12 Inherited Slot: name
  • Value type: symbol
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: name
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.19.5.12.1 Description

Name of this object - used when addressing the object internally or through simulation paramaters.

5.2.1.20 Class: network-control-command
5.2.1.20.1 Inheritance
  • Parent classes: communications-control-command
  • Precedence list: network-control-command, communications-control-command, message, event, owned object, named-object, lens object, standard-object, slot object, t
  • Direct subclasses: None.
5.2.1.20.2 Description

Not documented.

5.2.1.20.3 Direct Slots
5.2.1.20.4 Indirect Slots

5.2.1.20.4.1 Slot: argument
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: argument
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.20.4.1.1 Description

Additional arguments with command

5.2.1.20.4.2 Inherited Slot: timestamp
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: 0.0d0
  • Initargs: timestamp
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.20.4.2.1 Description

Utility time stamp field for user

5.2.1.20.4.3 Slot: to
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.20.4.3.1 Description

Module or Gate which finally receices message (after a delay if appropriate)

5.2.1.20.4.4 Slot: from
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.20.4.4.1 Description

Module or gate from which message was originally sent.

5.2.1.20.4.5 Inherited Slot: creation-time
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: (SIMULATION-TIME)
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.20.4.5.1 Description

The creation time of the message. With cloned messages (see duplicate later), the creation time of the original message is returned and not the time of the cloning operation. This is particularly useful when modeling communication protocols, because many protocols clone the transmitted packages to be able to do retransmissions and/or segmentation/reassembly.

5.2.1.20.4.6 Inherited Slot: root-event
  • Value type: event
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.20.4.6.1 Description

Top level root for cloned messages

5.2.1.20.4.7 Slot: schedule-id
  • Value type: integer
  • Initial value: -1
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.20.4.7.1 Description

Used to ensure events with same time and priority are scheduled in order of scheduling

5.2.1.20.4.8 Slot: priority
  • Value type: fixnum
  • Initial value: 0
  • Initargs: priority
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.20.4.8.1 Description

Determines delivery of messages with same arrival time

5.2.1.20.4.9 Inherited Slot: arrival-time
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: -1.0d0
  • Initargs: time
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.20.4.9.1 Description

simulation time at which event is to be handled

5.2.1.20.4.10 Inherited Slot: sent-time
  • Value type: double-float
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.20.4.10.1 Description

The simulation time the message was sent.

5.2.1.20.4.11 Slot: rank
  • Value type: fixnum
  • Initial value: -1
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.20.4.11.1 Description

Rank in priority queue - used internally for efficient removal from queue.

5.2.1.20.4.12 Inherited Slot: owner
  • Value type: named-object
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: owner
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.20.4.12.1 Description

  • Value type: fixnum

  • Initargs: index
  • Allocation: instance

  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: name, command
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.20.4.14.1 Description

a t. NIL

a time-type. Default: 0.0d0. Node offset startup delay in seconds

5.2.1.23 Class: physical-process
5.2.1.23.1 Inheritance
  • Parent classes: module
  • Precedence list: physical-process, module, component, parameter-object, entity-with-signals, owned object, named-object, lens object, standard-object, slot object, t
  • Direct subclasses: direct-node-physical-process, scenario-physical-process
5.2.1.23.2 Parameters
description
a string. Description of physical process - default
function
a (eval :type function). Default: =#'(LAMBDA (M C TM) (DECLARE (IGNORE M C TM)) (UNIFORM 0.0 1.0))=. a real function of measurand, location and time
5.2.1.23.3 Description

Not documented.

  • Value type: string
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: description
  • Allocation: instance

  • Properties: nil

  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: (format (eval type function))

5.2.1.24 Class: radio
5.2.1.24.1 Inheritance
  • Parent classes: comms-module
  • Precedence list: radio, comms-module, wsn-module, with-timers, module, component, parameter-object, entity-with-signals, owned-object, named-object, lens-object, standard-object, slot-object, t
  • Direct subclasses: None.
5.2.1.24.2 Parameters
address
a integer. MAC address - will default to node index.
parameters-file
a pathname. the file that contains most radio parameters
initial-mode
a symbol. we can choose an rx-mode to begin with. Modes are defined in the RadioParametersFile. nil means use the first mode defined)
state
a symbol. Default: ='RX=. we can choose a radio state to begin with. RX and TX are always there. according to the radio defined we can choose from a different set of sleep states
initial-tx-output-power
a float. we can choose a Txpower to begin with. Possible tx power values are defined in the RadioParametersFile. nil means use the first tx power defined (which is also the highest)
initial-sleep-level
a symbol. we can choose a sleep level which will be used when a transition to SLEEP state is requested. nil means use first level defined (will usually be the fastest and most energy consuming sleep state)
carrier-frequency
a float. Default: 2.4e9. the carrier frequency (in Hz) to begin with.
collision-model
a symbol. Default: ='ADDITIVE-INTERFERENCE-MODEL=. none, simple, additive or advance interference
cca-threshold
a float. Default: -95. the threshold of the RSSI register (in dBm) were above it channel is NOT clear
symbols-for-rssi
a integer. Default: 8. NIL
carrier-sense-interrupt-enabled
a boolean. NIL
max-phy-frame-size
a fixnum. Default: 1024. in bytes
avg-busy-frame
a time-type. Default: 1.0d0. integration time for measuring avg busy time
processing-delay
a time-type. Default: 1.d-5. delay to pass packets/messages/interrupts to upper layer
5.2.1.24.3 Description

Not documented.

5.2.1.24.4 Direct Slots

5.2.1.24.4.1 Slot: address
  • Value type: integer
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil
5.2.1.24.4.1.1 Description

MAC address - will default to node index.

5.2.1.24.4.1.2 Accessors

5.2.1.24.4.1.2.1 Slot Accessor: mac-address
5.2.1.24.4.1.2.1.1 Syntax 
(mac-address object)
5.2.1.24.4.1.2.1.2 Methods
  • (mac-address (radio lens.wsn:radio))
  • (mac-address (node lens.wsn:node))
  • (mac-address (mac lens.wsn:mac))

5.2.1.24.4.2 Slot: parameters-file
  • Value type: pathname
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil
5.2.1.24.4.2.1 Description

the file that contains most radio parameters

5.2.1.24.4.2.2 Accessors

5.2.1.24.4.2.2.1 Slot Accessor: parameters-file
5.2.1.24.4.2.2.1.1 Syntax 
(parameters-file object)
5.2.1.24.4.2.2.1.2 Methods
  • (parameters-file (radio lens.wsn:radio))

5.2.1.24.4.3 Slot: initial-mode
  • Value type: symbol
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil
5.2.1.24.4.3.1 Description

we can choose an rx-mode to begin with. Modes are defined in the RadioParametersFile. nil means use the first mode defined)

5.2.1.24.4.4 Slot: state
  • Value type: symbol
  • Initial value: ='LENS.WSN:RX=
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil
5.2.1.24.4.4.1 Description

we can choose a radio state to begin with. RX and TX are always there. according to the radio defined we can choose from a different set of sleep states

5.2.1.24.4.4.2 Accessors

5.2.1.24.4.4.2.1 Slot Accessor: state
5.2.1.24.4.4.2.1.1 Syntax 
(state instance)
5.2.1.24.4.4.2.1.2 Description

Return current state of instance

5.2.1.24.4.4.2.1.3 Methods
  • (state (mac802.15.4 lens.wsn:mac802.15.4))
  • (state (tmac lens.wsn:tmac))
  • (state (tuneable-mac lens.wsn:tuneable-mac))
  • (state (radio lens.wsn:radio))

5.2.1.24.4.5 Slot: initial-tx-output-power
  • Value type: float
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil
5.2.1.24.4.5.1 Description

we can choose a Txpower to begin with. Possible tx power values are defined in the RadioParametersFile. nil means use the first tx power defined (which is also the highest)

5.2.1.24.4.6 Slot: initial-sleep-level
  • Value type: symbol
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil
5.2.1.24.4.6.1 Description

we can choose a sleep level which will be used when a transition to SLEEP state is requested. nil means use first level defined (will usually be the fastest and most energy consuming sleep state)

5.2.1.24.4.7 Slot: carrier-frequency

5.2.1.25 Class: radio-control-command
5.2.1.25.1 Inheritance
  • Parent classes: communications-control-command
  • Precedence list: radio-control-command, communications-control-command, message, event, owned-object, named-object, lens-object, standard-object, slot-object, t
  • Direct subclasses: None.
5.2.1.25.2 Description

Not documented.

5.2.1.25.3 Direct Slots
5.2.1.25.4 Indirect Slots

5.2.1.25.4.1 Slot: argument
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: argument
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.25.4.1.1 Description

Additional arguments with command

5.2.1.25.4.2 Inherited Slot: timestamp
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: 0.0d0
  • Initargs: timestamp
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.25.4.2.1 Description

Utility time stamp field for user

5.2.1.25.4.3 Slot: to
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.25.4.3.1 Description

Module or Gate which finally receices message (after a delay if appropriate)

5.2.1.25.4.4 Slot: from
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.25.4.4.1 Description

Module or gate from which message was originally sent.

5.2.1.25.4.5 Inherited Slot: creation-time
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: (SIMULATION-TIME)
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.25.4.5.1 Description

The creation time of the message. With cloned messages (see duplicate later), the creation time of the original message is returned and not the time of the cloning operation. This is particularly useful when modeling communication protocols, because many protocols clone the transmitted packages to be able to do retransmissions and/or segmentation/reassembly.

5.2.1.25.4.6 Inherited Slot: root-event
  • Value type: event
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.25.4.6.1 Description

Top level root for cloned messages

5.2.1.25.4.7 Slot: schedule-id
  • Value type: integer
  • Initial value: -1
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.25.4.7.1 Description

Used to ensure events with same time and priority are scheduled in order of scheduling

5.2.1.25.4.8 Slot: priority
  • Value type: fixnum
  • Initial value: 0
  • Initargs: priority
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.25.4.8.1 Description

Determines delivery of messages with same arrival time

5.2.1.25.4.9 Inherited Slot: arrival-time
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: -1.0d0
  • Initargs: time
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.25.4.9.1 Description

simulation time at which event is to be handled

5.2.1.25.4.10 Inherited Slot: sent-time
  • Value type: double-float
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.25.4.10.1 Description

The simulation time the message was sent.

5.2.1.25.4.11 Slot: rank
  • Value type: fixnum
  • Initial value: -1
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.25.4.11.1 Description

Rank in priority queue - used internally for efficient removal from queue.

  • Value type: named-object
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: owner
  • Allocation: instance

  • Value type: fixnum
  • Initial value: NIL

  • Allocation: instance

  • Value type: symbol
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: name, command
  • Allocation: instance

Command is held as message name

  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: 0.0d0
  • Initargs: timestamp
  • Allocation: instance

  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.26.4.3.1 Description

Module or Gate which finally receices message (after a delay if appropriate)

5.2.1.26.4.4 Slot: from
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.26.4.4.1 Description

Module or gate from which message was originally sent.

5.2.1.26.4.5 Inherited Slot: creation-time
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: (SIMULATION-TIME)
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.26.4.5.1 Description

The creation time of the message. With cloned messages (see duplicate later), the creation time of the original message is returned and not the time of the cloning operation. This is particularly useful when modeling communication protocols, because many protocols clone the transmitted packages to be able to do retransmissions and/or segmentation/reassembly.

5.2.1.26.4.6 Inherited Slot: root-event
  • Value type: event
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.26.4.6.1 Description

Top level root for cloned messages

5.2.1.26.4.7 Slot: schedule-id
  • Value type: integer
  • Initial value: -1
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.26.4.7.1 Description

Used to ensure events with same time and priority are scheduled in order of scheduling

5.2.1.26.4.8 Slot: priority
  • Value type: fixnum
  • Initial value: 0
  • Initargs: priority
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.26.4.8.1 Description

Determines delivery of messages with same arrival time

5.2.1.26.4.9 Inherited Slot: arrival-time
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: -1.0d0
  • Initargs: time
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.26.4.9.1 Description

simulation time at which event is to be handled

5.2.1.28 Class: resources
5.2.1.28.1 Inheritance
  • Parent classes: wsn-module
  • Precedence list: resources, wsn-module, with-timers, module, component, parameter-object, entity-with-signals, owned object, named-object, lens object, standard-object, slot object, t
  • Direct subclasses: None.
5.2.1.28.2 Parameters
ram-size
a integer. Default: 0. in kB
flash-size
a integer. Default: 0. in kB
flash-write-cost
a integer. Default: 0. in kB
ram-read-cost
a integer. Default: 0. in kB
cpu-power-levels
a list. plist mapping power level names to power
cpu-power-level
a symbol. Current power level - initialised from parameter
clock-drift-sigma
a time-type. Default: 3.d-5. Standard deviation in cpu clock drift
remaining-energy
a double-float. Default: 18720.0d0. In joules - default is 2 AA batteries
baseline-node-power
a real. Default: 0.006. Periodic power consumption
update-interval
a time-type. Default: 1.0d0. Interval for periodic updates in energy
5.2.1.28.3 Description

Not documented.

5.2.1.28.4 Direct Slots

5.2.1.28.4.1 Slot: ram-size
  • Value type: integer
  • Initial value: 0
  • Initargs: ram-size
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil
5.2.1.28.4.1.1 Description

in kB

  • Value type: integer
  • Initial value: 0
  • Initargs: flash-size
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil

in kB

  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.29.5.10.1 Description

RNG map for this component

5.2.1.29.5.11 Slot: collect-trace-info
  • Value type: boolean
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.29.5.11.1 Description

If true tracelog outputs will be traced for this component.

5.2.1.29.5.12 Slot: properties
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: properties
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.29.5.12.1 Description

Per instance property list

5.2.1.29.5.13 Slot: has-ancestor-listeners
  • Value type: simple-bit-vector
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.29.5.13.1 Description

A bit map recording which signals have ancestor listeners.

5.2.1.29.5.14 Slot: has-local-listeners
  • Value type: simple-bit-vector
  • Initial value: (MAKE-ARRAY LENS::+SIGNAL-CACHE-SIZE+ :ELEMENT-TYPE 'BIT :INITIAL-ELEMENT 0)
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.29.5.14.1 Description

A bit map recording which signals have local listeners.

5.2.1.29.5.15 Slot: signal-table
  • Value type: hash-table
  • Initial value: (MAKE-HASH-TABLE)
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.29.5.15.1 Description

  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: owner
  • Allocation: instance

  • Value type: symbol
  • Initial value: NIL

  • Allocation: instance

5.2.1.30 Class: routing-packet
5.2.1.30.1 Inheritance
  • Parent classes: wsn-packet
  • Precedence list: routing-packet, wsn-packet, packet, message, event, owned-object, named-object, lens-object, standard-object, slot-object, t
  • Direct subclasses: multipath-rings-routing-packet, leach-routing-packet
5.2.1.30.2 Description

A generic routing packet header. An app packet will be encapsulated in it. If definining your own routing protocol and need a more specialized packet you have to create one the extends this generic packet.

5.2.1.30.3 Direct Slots
5.2.1.30.4 Indirect Slots

5.2.1.30.4.1 Slot: sequence-number
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: sequence-number, seqnum
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.30.4.1.1 Description

a field to distinguish between packets

5.2.1.30.4.2 Internal Slot: destination
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: destination
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.30.4.2.1 Description

the destination address of the packet to be sent

5.2.1.30.4.3 Internal Slot: source
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: source
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.30.4.3.1 Description

the source address of the received packet

5.2.1.30.4.4 Slot: header-overhead
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: 0
  • Initargs: byte-length, header-overhead
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.30.4.4.1 Description

In bytes

5.2.1.30.4.5 Inherited Slot: bit-error-p
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.30.4.5.1 Description

The result of error modelling after the packet is sent through a channel that has a nonzero packet error rate (PER) or bit error rate (BER). It is up to the receiver to examine this flag after having received the packet, and to act upon it.

5.2.1.30.4.6 Slot: reception-start-p
  • Value type: boolean
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: deliver-on-reception-start
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.30.4.6.1 Description

Identify whether this packet represents the start or the end of the reception after the packet travelled through a channel with a data rate. This flag is controlled by the deliver-on-reception-start flag of the receiving gate.

5.2.1.30.4.7 Inherited Slot: control-info
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: control-info
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.30.4.7.1 Description

Additional data to be passed with packet between protocol layers.

5.2.1.30.4.8 Internal Slot: duration
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: 0.0d0
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.30.4.8.1 Description

Duration of last transmission

5.2.1.30.4.9 Slot: encapsulated-packet
  • Value type: packet
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: encapsulated-packet
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.30.4.9.1 Description

Higher level encapsulated protocol packet.

5.2.1.30.4.10 Inherited Slot: timestamp
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: 0.0d0
  • Initargs: timestamp
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.30.4.10.1 Description

Utility time stamp field for user

5.2.1.30.4.11 Slot: to
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.30.4.11.1 Description

Module or Gate which finally receices message (after a delay if appropriate)

5.2.1.30.4.12 Slot: from
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.30.4.12.1 Description

Module or gate from which message was originally sent.

5.2.1.30.4.13 Inherited Slot: creation-time
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: (SIMULATION-TIME)
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.30.4.13.1 Description

The creation time of the message. With cloned messages (see duplicate later), the creation time of the original message is returned and not the time of the cloning operation. This is particularly useful when modeling communication protocols, because many protocols clone the transmitted packages to be able to do retransmissions and/or segmentation/reassembly.

5.2.1.30.4.14 Inherited Slot: root-event
  • Value type: event
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.30.4.14.1 Description

Top level root for cloned messages

5.2.1.30.4.15 Slot: schedule-id
  • Value type: integer
  • Initial value: -1
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.30.4.15.1 Description

Used to ensure events with same time and priority are scheduled in order of scheduling

5.2.1.30.4.16 Slot: priority
  • Value type: fixnum
  • Initial value: 0
  • Initargs: priority
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.30.4.16.1 Description

Determines delivery of messages with same arrival time

5.2.1.30.4.17 Inherited Slot: arrival-time
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: -1.0d0
  • Initargs: time
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.30.4.17.1 Description

simulation time at which event is to be handled

5.2.1.30.4.18 Inherited Slot: sent-time
  • Value type: double-float
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.30.4.18.1 Description

The simulation time the message was sent.

5.2.1.30.4.19 Slot: rank
  • Value type: fixnum
  • Initial value: -1
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.30.4.19.1 Description

Rank in priority queue - used internally for efficient removal from queue.

5.2.1.30.4.20 Inherited Slot: owner
  • Value type: named-object
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: owner
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.30.4.20.1 Description

Object which owns this in object heirarchy

5.2.1.30.4.21 Inherited Slot: index
  • Value type: fixnum
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: index
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.30.4.21.1 Description

Position in an object vector (if it is in an object array)

5.2.1.30.4.22 Inherited Slot: name
  • Value type: symbol
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: name
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.30.4.22.1 Description

Name of this object - used when addressing the object internally or through simulation paramaters.

5.2.1.31 Class: tmac
5.2.1.31.1 Inheritance
  • Parent classes: mac
  • Precedence list: tmac, mac, comms-module, wsn-module, with-timers, module, component, parameter-object, entity-with-signals, owned-object, named-object, lens-object, standard-object, slot-object, t
  • Direct subclasses: None.
5.2.1.31.2 Parameters
print-state-transitions
a boolean. Debugging parameter
ack-packet-size
a integer. Default: 11. NIL
sync-packet-size
a integer. Default: 11. NIL
rts-packet-size
a integer. Default: 13. NIL
cts-packet-size
a integer. Default: 13. NIL
max-mac-frame-size
a t. Default: 0. NIL
header-overhead
a t. Default: 11. NIL
buffer-size
a t. Default: 32. NIL
max-tx-retries
a integer. Default: 2. NIL
allow-sink-sync
a boolean. Default: T. allows sink node to start synchronisation immediately
use-frts
a boolean. enable/disable FRTS (Future Request To Send), true value not supported
use-rts-cts
a boolean. Default: T. enable/disable RTS/CTS handshake
disable-ta-extension
a boolean. disabling TA extension effectively creates an SMAC protocol
conservative-ta
a boolean. Default: T. conservative activation timeout - will always stay awake for at least 15 ms after any activity on the radio
resync-time
a time-type. Default: 6.0d0. time for re-sending SYNC msg, in seconds
contention-period
a time-type. Default: 0.01. NIL
listen-timeout
a time-type. Default: 0.015. 15 ms, is the timeout TA (Activation event)
wait-timeout
a time-type. Default: 0.005. timeout for expecting a reply to DATA or RTS packet
frame-time
a time-type. Default: 0.61. frame time (standard = 610ms)
collision-resolution
a symbol. Default: ='IMMEDIATE-RETRY=. collision resolution mechanism, choose from 'immediate-retry (low collision avoidance) 'overhearing (default) 'retry-next-frame (aggressive collision avoidance)
5.2.1.31.3 Description

TMAC

5.2.1.31.4 Direct Slots

5.2.1.31.4.1 Slot: print-state-transitions
  • Value type: boolean
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil
5.2.1.31.4.1.1 Description

Debugging parameter

5.2.1.31.4.2 Slot: ack-packet-size
  • Value type: integer
  • Initial value: 11
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil

5.2.1.31.4.3 Slot: sync-packet-size
  • Value type: integer
  • Initial value: 11
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil

5.2.1.31.4.4 Slot: rts-packet-size

  • Initial value: 13
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil

5.2.1.31.4.5 Slot: cts-packet-size
  • Value type: integer
  • Initial value: 13
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil

  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: 0
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil

  • Initial value: 11
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil

  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil
5.2.1.31.4.14.1 Description

  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil

  • Initial value: 0.61
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil

5.2.1.31.4.20 Slot: collision-resolution
  • Value type: symbol
  • Initial value: ='LENS.WSN.MAC.TMAC::IMMEDIATE-RETRY=
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil
5.2.1.31.4.20.1 Description

collision resolution mechanism, choose from 'immediate-retry (low collision avoidance) 'overhearing (default) 'retry-next-frame (aggressive collision avoidance)

5.2.1.31.4.21 Slot: state
  • Value type: tmac-state
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.31.4.21.1 Accessors

(state instance)
5.2.1.31.4.21.1.1.2 Description

  • (state (radio lens.wsn:radio))

5.2.1.32 Class: tuneable-mac
5.2.1.32.1 Inheritance
  • Parent classes: mac
  • Precedence list: tuneable-mac, mac, comms-module, wsn-module, with-timers, module, component, parameter-object, entity-with-signals, owned object, named-object, lens object, standard-object, slot object, t
  • Direct subclasses: None.
5.2.1.32.2 Parameters
duty-cycle
a float. Default: 1.0. listening / (sleeping+listening)
listen-interval
a time-type. Default: 0.01. how long do we leave the radio in listen mode, in ms
beacon-interval-fraction
a float. Default: 1.0. fraction of the sleeping interval that we send beacons
probability-tx
a float. Default: 1.0. the probability of a single try of Transmission to happen
num-tx
a integer. Default: 1. when we have something to Tx, how many times we try
random-tx-offset
a time-type. Default: 0.0d0. Tx after time chosen randomly from interval [0..randomTxOffset]
retx-interval
a time-type. Default: 0.0d0. Interval between retransmissions in ms, (numTx-1) retransmissions
backoff-type
a symbol. Default: ='CONSTANT=. sleep-interval, constant, multiplying (e.g. 1*a, 2*a, 3*a, 4*a …), exponential (e.g. 2, 4, 8, 16, 32…)
backoff-base-value
a time-type. Default: 0.016d0. NIL
csma-persistence
a (number :min 0 :max 1 :coerce-to float). Default: 0. value in [0..1], is CSMA non-persistent, p-persistent, or 1-persistent?
tx-all-packets-in-free-channel
a boolean. Default: T. if you find the channel free, tx all packets in buffer?
sleep-during-backoff
a boolean. for no dutyCycle case: sleep when backing off
beacon-frame-size
a integer. Default: 125. have a big beacon, to avoid much processing overhead, but fit at least 2 in the listening interval
5.2.1.32.3 Description

Default parameter values will result in non-persistent CSMA-CA behaviour

5.2.1.32.4 Direct Slots

5.2.1.32.4.1 Slot: duty-cycle
  • Value type: float
  • Initial value: 1.0
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil

listening / (sleeping+listening)

5.2.1.32.5.19 Inherited Slot: name
  • Value type: symbol
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: name
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.32.5.19.1 Description

Name of this object - used when addressing the object internally or through simulation paramaters.

5.2.1.33 Class: wireless-channel
5.2.1.33.1 Inheritance
  • Parent classes: compound-module
  • Precedence list: wireless-channel, compound module, module, component, parameter-object, entity-with signals, owned-object, named object, lens-object, standard object, slot-object, t
  • Direct subclasses: None.
5.2.1.33.2 Parameters
cell-size
a coord. Default: (MAKE-COORD 5.0 5.0 1.0). Size of cells in each dimension (for mobility)
signal-delivery-threshold
a real. Default: -100.0. threshold in dBm above which, wireless channel module is delivering signal messages to radio modules of individual nodes
5.2.1.33.3 Description

The wireless channel module simulates the wireless medium. Nodes sent packets to it and according to various conditions (fading, interference etc) it is decided which nodes can receive this packet.

5.2.1.33.4 Direct Slots

5.2.1.33.4.1 Slot: cell-size
  • Value type: coord
  • Initial value: (MAKE-COORD 5.0 5.0 1.0)
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil
5.2.1.33.4.1.1 Description

Size of cells in each dimension (for mobility)

5.2.1.33.4.1.2 Accessors

5.2.1.33.4.1.2.1 Slot Accessor: cell-size
5.2.1.33.4.1.2.1.1 Syntax 
(cell-size object)
5.2.1.33.4.1.2.1.2 Methods
  • (cell-size (wireless-channel lens.wsn:wireless-channel))

5.2.1.33.4.2 Slot: field
  • Value type: coord
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.33.4.2.1 Description

wireless coverage field (may be larger than network field

5.2.1.33.4.2.2 Accessors

5.2.1.33.4.2.2.1 Slot Accessor: field
5.2.1.33.4.2.2.1.1 Syntax 
(field object)
5.2.1.33.4.2.2.1.2 Methods
  • (field (wireless-channel lens.wsn:wireless-channel))
  • (field (wsn lens.wsn:wsn))

5.2.1.33.4.3 Slot: signal-delivery-threshold
  • Value type: real
  • Initial value: -100.0
  • Initargs: signal-delivery-threshold
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil
5.2.1.33.4.3.1 Description

threshold in dBm above which, wireless channel module is delivering signal messages to radio modules of individual nodes

5.2.1.33.4.3.2 Accessors

5.2.1.33.4.3.2.1 Slot Accessor: signal-delivery-threshold
5.2.1.33.4.3.2.1.1 Syntax 
(signal-delivery-threshold object)
5.2.1.33.4.3.2.1.2 Methods
  • (signal-delivery-threshold (wireless-channel lens.wsn:wireless-channel))

5.2.1.33.4.4 Slot: temporal-model
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.33.4.4.1 Description

the temporal channel variation model

5.2.1.33.4.4.2 Accessors

5.2.1.33.4.4.2.1 Slot Accessor: temporal-model
5.2.1.33.4.4.2.1.1 Syntax 
(temporal-model object)
5.2.1.33.4.4.2.1.2 Methods
  • (temporal-model (wireless-channel lens.wsn:wireless-channel))

  • Value type: real
  • Initial value: 0.0

  • Allocation: instance

5.2.1.34 Class: wsn
5.2.1.34.1 Inheritance
  • Parent classes: network
  • Precedence list: wsn, network, compound-module, module, component, parameter-object, entity-with-signals, owned object, named-object, lens object, standard-object, slot object, t
  • Direct subclasses: None.
5.2.1.34.2 Parameters
field
a coord. Default: (MAKE-COORD 30.0d0 30.0d0). Size of deployment field
num-nodes
a fixnum. Default: 30. Number of nodes
num-physical-processes
a fixnum. Default: 1. Number of physical processes
deployment
a read. Default: ='UNIFORM=. Node deployment spec
5.2.1.34.3 Description

Not documented.

5.2.1.34.4 Direct Slots

5.2.1.34.4.1 Slot: field
  • Value type: coord
  • Initial value: (MAKE-COORD 30.0d0 30.0d0)
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil
5.2.1.34.4.1.1 Description

Size of deployment field

5.2.1.34.4.1.2 Accessors

(field object)
5.2.1.34.4.1.2.1.2 Methods
  • (field (wireless-channel lens.wsn:wireless-channel))
  • (field (wsn lens.wsn:wsn))

5.2.1.34.4.2 Slot: num-nodes
  • Value type: fixnum
  • Initial value: 30
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
  • Parameter: t
  • Properties: nil

5.2.1.36 Class: wsn-packet
5.2.1.36.1 Inheritance
  • Parent classes: packet
  • Precedence list: wsn-packet, packet, message, event, owned object, named-object, lens object, standard-object, slot object, t
  • Direct subclasses: mac-packet, routing-packet
5.2.1.36.2 Description

Base class for network and link layer packets

5.2.1.36.3 Direct Slots

5.2.1.36.3.1 Slot: header-overhead
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: 0
  • Initargs: byte-length, header-overhead
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.36.3.1.1 Description

In bytes

5.2.1.36.3.1.2 Accessors

5.2.1.36.3.1.2.1.1 Syntax 
(header-overhead object)
5.2.1.36.3.1.2.1.2 Methods
  • (header-overhead (comms-module lens.wsn:comms-module))
  • (header-overhead (wsn-packet lens.wsn:wsn-packet))
  • (header-overhead (application lens.wsn:application))
  • (header-overhead (wireless-signal-end lens.wsn::wireless-signal-end))

5.2.1.36.3.2 Internal Slot: source
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: source
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.36.3.2.1 Description

the source address of the received packet

  • (source (app-net-control-info lens.wsn:app-net-control-info))

  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: destination
  • Allocation: instance

the destination address of the packet to be sent

  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: sequence-number, seqnum
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.36.3.4.1 Description

a field to distinguish between packets

5.2.1.36.3.4.2 Accessors

5.2.1.36.3.4.2.1 Slot Accessor: sequence-number
5.2.1.36.3.4.2.1.1 Syntax 
(sequence-number object)
5.2.1.36.3.4.2.1.2 Methods
  • (sequence-number (wsn-packet lens.wsn:wsn-packet))
  • (sequence-number (application-packet lens.wsn:application-packet))
5.2.1.36.4 Indirect Slots

5.2.1.36.4.1 Inherited Slot: bit-error-p
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.36.4.1.1 Description

The result of error modelling after the packet is sent through a channel that has a nonzero packet error rate (PER) or bit error rate (BER). It is up to the receiver to examine this flag after having received the packet, and to act upon it.

5.2.1.36.4.2 Slot: reception-start-p
  • Value type: boolean
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: deliver-on-reception-start
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.36.4.2.1 Description

Identify whether this packet represents the start or the end of the reception after the packet travelled through a channel with a data rate. This flag is controlled by the deliver-on-reception-start flag of the receiving gate.

5.2.1.36.4.3 Inherited Slot: control-info
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: control-info
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.36.4.3.1 Description

Additional data to be passed with packet between protocol layers.

5.2.1.36.4.4 Internal Slot: duration
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: 0.0d0
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.36.4.4.1 Description

Duration of last transmission

5.2.1.36.4.5 Slot: encapsulated-packet
  • Value type: packet
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: encapsulated-packet
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.36.4.5.1 Description

Higher level encapsulated protocol packet.

5.2.1.36.4.6 Inherited Slot: timestamp
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: 0.0d0
  • Initargs: timestamp
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.36.4.6.1 Description

Utility time stamp field for user

5.2.1.36.4.7 Slot: to
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.36.4.7.1 Description

Module or Gate which finally receices message (after a delay if appropriate)

5.2.1.36.4.8 Slot: from
  • Value type: t
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.36.4.8.1 Description

Module or gate from which message was originally sent.

5.2.1.36.4.9 Inherited Slot: creation-time
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: (SIMULATION-TIME)
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.36.4.9.1 Description

The creation time of the message. With cloned messages (see duplicate later), the creation time of the original message is returned and not the time of the cloning operation. This is particularly useful when modeling communication protocols, because many protocols clone the transmitted packages to be able to do retransmissions and/or segmentation/reassembly.

5.2.1.36.4.10 Inherited Slot: root-event
  • Value type: event
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.36.4.10.1 Description

Top level root for cloned messages

5.2.1.36.4.11 Slot: schedule-id
  • Value type: integer
  • Initial value: -1
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.36.4.11.1 Description

Used to ensure events with same time and priority are scheduled in order of scheduling

5.2.1.36.4.12 Slot: priority
  • Value type: fixnum
  • Initial value: 0
  • Initargs: priority
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.36.4.12.1 Description

Determines delivery of messages with same arrival time

5.2.1.36.4.13 Inherited Slot: arrival-time
  • Value type: time-type
  • Initial value: -1.0d0
  • Initargs: time
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.36.4.13.1 Description

simulation time at which event is to be handled

5.2.1.36.4.14 Inherited Slot: sent-time
  • Value type: double-float
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.36.4.14.1 Description

The simulation time the message was sent.

5.2.1.36.4.15 Slot: rank
  • Value type: fixnum
  • Initial value: -1
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.36.4.15.1 Description

Rank in priority queue - used internally for efficient removal from queue.

5.2.1.36.4.16 Inherited Slot: owner
  • Value type: named-object
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: owner
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.36.4.16.1 Description

Object which owns this in object heirarchy

5.2.1.36.4.17 Inherited Slot: index
  • Value type: fixnum
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: index
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.36.4.17.1 Description

Position in an object vector (if it is in an object array)

5.2.1.36.4.18 Inherited Slot: name
  • Value type: symbol
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: name
  • Allocation: instance
5.2.1.36.4.18.1 Description

Name of this object - used when addressing the object internally or through simulation paramaters.

5.2.2 External Structures

5.2.2.1 Structure: cell
5.2.2.1.1 Description

Not documented.

5.2.2.1.2 Slots

5.2.2.1.2.1 Inherited Slot: coord
  • Value type: coord
  • Initial value: (MAKE-COORD)
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance

5.2.2.1.2.2 Slot: occupation
  • Value type: list
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance

5.2.2.1.2.3 Slot: path-loss
  • Value type: list
  • Initial value: NIL
  • Initargs: none
  • Allocation: instance

5.2.6.18 Inherited Function: exponential
5.2.6.18.1 Syntax
(exponential mean &optional (rng 0))
5.2.6.18.2 Arguments
mean
a real number
5.2.6.18.3 Optional Arguments
rng
an integer (default 0)
5.2.6.18.4 Description

Returns a random variate double float from the exponential distribution with the given mean mean (that is, with parameter lambda=1/mean/) from random number stream rng in the current context.

5.2.6.19 Inherited Function: exponential

5.2.6.19.2 Arguments

a real number
5.2.6.19.3 Optional Arguments
rng
an integer (default 0)
5.2.6.19.4 Description

Returns a random variate double float from the exponential distribution with the given mean mean (that is, with parameter lambda=1/mean/) from random number stream rng in the current context.

5.2.6.58.2 Description

Set new state of a protocol implementation. Description may be used to add comments for tracing. print-state-transitions parameter slot switches on tracing of this. state is stored in slate slot.

6 Colophon

This documentation was generated from Common Lisp source code using CLOD, version 1.0. The latest version of CLOD is available here.

Footnotes:

1 This is a substantial difference from OMNET were all behaviour had to be in simple modules and a common pattern was to have to create simple modules that would then modify the connectivity in their parent compound modules

2 Another significant difference from OMNET++ where the parameters were declared in the ned files and had to be explicitely read in the C++ implementation code to configure the modules.

Date: 2014-04-09 11:10:18 BST

Author: Dr. John A.R. Williams

Org version 7.8.02 with Emacs version 23

Validate XHTML 1.0
